main event: A star-shaped object, appearing the size of a pin-head and colored red and green, was observed moving in a steady course in Thermopolis, Wyoming on September 5, 1958.
interesting points: The object was first noticed by a 16-year-old student named Dick Boots., The sighting lasted for 4-5 minutes and was without optical aids., The object was reported to be moving north and later northwesterly., The initial observation was made around 5:48 AM at night under clear conditions., Negative reports indicated the object may have been a star or planet, possibly Venus.
sighted object: star-shaped object approximately the size of a pin-head
witness description: One was a 16-year-old male student, and the other was a 34-year-old housewife.
